questions.question: What is the primary psychological shift required when transitioning from the 'Solo Practitioner' phase to the 'CEO' phase of a Tantra practice?
options: Mastering more advanced tantric techniques to charge higher prices
Shifting from 'doing the work' to 'designing the systems' that deliver the work
Eliminating all client contact to focus exclusively on marketing
Increasing the number of hours worked per week to manage more clients
questions.explanation: The CEO phase requires moving away from being the sole operator of every task and focusing on the systems, infrastructure, and team that allow the practice to scale without the founder's constant manual input.

questions.question: When scaling to group retreats (L2), what is the recommended 'Safety-to-Participant Ratio' for intensive Tantric containers?
options: 1 facilitator per 20 participants
1 facilitator per 15 participants
1 facilitator per 6–8 participants
1 facilitator per 2 participants
questions.explanation: To maintain high energetic safety and provide adequate support during emotional or somatic releases, a ratio of 1 facilitator per 6–8 participants is the industry standard for premium Tantric retreats.

questions.question: In the context of Digital Expansion (L3), which delivery model offers the highest scalability while maintaining a high level of student transformation?
options: The 'Evergreen' DIY course with no support
The 'Hybrid Model' combining pre-recorded curriculum with live group mentorship
One-on-one sessions delivered via Zoom
A daily live broadcast with no curriculum
questions.explanation: The Hybrid Model is considered the 'Gold Standard' for scaling because it leverages pre-recorded content for information delivery while using live group sessions for high-impact integration and support.

questions.question: According to Lesson 4, which role is typically the most critical first 'Operations' hire for a practitioner moving into the Scaling phase?
options: A second Lead Facilitator
A Social Media Influencer
An Online Business Manager (OBM) or Executive Assistant
A full-time Video Editor
questions.explanation: An OBM or Executive Assistant handles the administrative and operational 'noise,' allowing the practitioner to stay in their 'Zone of Genius'—teaching and holding space.

questions.question: A 'Mastermind' architecture (L5) differs from a standard group course primarily because:
options: It is much cheaper and accessible to more people
It focuses on peer-to-peer connection and high-level proximity to the mentor
It is entirely automated with no live interaction
It only lasts for one weekend
questions.explanation: Masterminds are high-ticket offerings where the value is derived from the caliber of the peer group and the direct, intimate proximity to the lead mentor's wisdom.

questions.question: In Advanced Marketing Systems (L6), what is the purpose of a 'Self-Liquidating Offer' (SLO)?
options: To make the practitioner the most famous person in the industry
To provide a free service to everyone who asks
To offset the cost of advertising by selling a low-ticket product at the front of the funnel
To close the business down after a successful launch
questions.explanation: An SLO is a low-cost product (usually $27-$97) designed to recoup ad spend immediately, allowing the practitioner to acquire new leads for 'free' before upselling them into higher-tier programs.

questions.question: Lesson 7 discusses 'Financial Integrity.' What is a common sign of 'Financial Leakage' in a scaling Tantra practice?
options: Reinvesting 20% of profits back into the business
Co-mingling personal and business expenses in a single account
Paying facilitators a fair market rate
Using automated bookkeeping software
questions.explanation: Co-mingling funds obscures the true profitability of the business and prevents the practitioner from making data-driven decisions about scaling and taxes.

questions.question: When building a 'Legacy' (L8), what is meant by 'Transpersonal Branding'?
options: Using a fake name to protect your privacy
Building a brand mission that is larger than the founder’s personality
Focusing only on the physical aspects of Tantra
Avoiding all branding and marketing entirely
questions.explanation: Transpersonal branding ensures the movement and the work can continue to impact the world even if the founder is not present, moving from a 'personality-led' to a 'mission-led' organization.

questions.question: A practitioner currently earns $10k/month from 20 private clients but is at maximum capacity. Which scaling move is most strategically sound based on Module 35?
options: Lowering prices to attract 20 more clients
Stopping all work to write a book for two years
Transitioning the 20 clients into two small-group 'Immersion' containers at a similar or higher price point
Hiring 5 more facilitators and taking a 50% commission on their work immediately
questions.explanation: Moving from 1-on-1 to group containers (Immersions) allows the practitioner to reclaim their time while maintaining or increasing revenue and deepening the collective energy of the work.

questions.question: According to industry data for high-ticket spiritual programs (L6), what is a healthy 'Lead-to-Call' conversion rate for a qualified application funnel?
questions.explanation: In high-ticket funnels, a 5% to 15% conversion rate from a lead (someone who watched a training) to a booked discovery call is considered a healthy, high-performing system.
